title: Cat. 54  Candelabra, 1873
publication_title: American Silver in the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Tiffany & Co. (American, founded 1837)  
Chasing by Eugene J. Soligny (American, c. 1833–1901)  
New York, New York  
Silver; 77.4 × 43.2 cm (30 1/2 × 17 in.)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, restricted gift of the Antiquarian Society through the Mr. and Mrs. William Y. Hutchinson Fund, 1985.221.1–2

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section curatorial_entry2" id="curatorial_entry2">On bottom of each (fig. 54.1)

Engraved on proper left side of base of each: EJ and S (fig. 54.2)

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">Viscount d’Itajubá (1805–1884).

By descent to Baron von Jenisch of Hamburg (d. 1985), by 1985.

Sotheby’s 1985, lot 19.

Sold to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1985.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">Vienna, International Exposition, 1873.

Art Institute of Chicago, A Decade of Decorative Arts: The Antiquarian Society of the Art Institute of Chicago, November 12, 1986–January 4, 1987, pp. 90–91, cat. 68 (ill.).

Boston, Museum of Fine Arts, The Silver of Tiffany & Co., 1850–1987, September 9–November 8, 1987, p. 28 (ill.), cat. 7a–b.

Dallas Museum of Art, Silver in America: A Century of Splendor, 1840–1940, November 6, 1994–January 29, 1995, pp. 64, 330, fig. 3-19 (ill.).

Pittsburgh, Carnegie Museum of Art, March 12–May 21, 1995; Milwaukee (WI) Museum of Art, June 18–August 13, 1995.

Wilmington, DE, Henry Francis du Pont Winterthur Museum, September 9, 1995–January 7, 1996.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Art-Journal (1873), pp. 245, 252 (ill.).

New York Times (1873), p. 1.

Frank Leslie’s Illustrated Newspaper (1878), p. 1 (ill.).

Art Institute of Chicago (1983), p. 34, fig. 58 (ill.).

Sotheby’s (1985), lot 19.

Naeve et al. (1986), pp. 90–91, cat. 68 (ill.).

C. Carpenter and Zapata (1987), pp. 28 (ill.), 53, cat. 76.

Armstrong (1988), pp. 822–35, 828 (ill.).

Schwartz (1988), pp. 38–39, 38 (ill.).

Maine Antique Digest (1991), p. 27D.

Venable (1995), pp. 64, 330, fig. 3.19 (ill.).

Thayer (1996), pp. 1, 8 (ill.).

Barter et al. (1998), pp. 220–23, cat. 103 (ill.).

Loring (2001), pp. 124–25 (ill.).

</section><section id="figures">Candelabra, 1873.

fig. 54.1 fig. 54.2 </section>
